website_summaries.verdict: The Asics GT 1000 5 is a middle to high-mileage stability trainer that works as designed. While it may not be as popular as some of Asics’ flagship stability shoes, it delivers a firm and responsive ride that slight to moderate overpronators should be very comfortable with. With average price point, runners can expect a durable shoe with lots of comfort and reliability for the rigors of day to day running.
pros: Amazingly comfortable, according to most of the reviewers
The GT 1000 5 is significantly lighter than the past model
It looks better and more sophisticated than the prior version
It is very stable without compromising weight, based on the comments of several runners
A handful noticed that the toe box has more room in the 5th version of the GT 1000 than earlier editions
Breathability is excellent, as remarked by more than a few
The overall support is improved in the 5th iteration of the GT 1000, as observed by several runners
A small number of runners have used it for gym workouts
Durability is quite good in this shoe, as reported by more than a few reviewers
The interior has adequate volume to accommodate different kinds of orthotics, based on the comments of more than a few reviewers
cons: A handful noted that it runs a bit small
A few had to give the shoe a break-in period
The forefoot is rather tight, according to a small number of runners who have tried the earlier models of this series
A handful of runners found the 4E and 2E options as too narrow
Some runners experienced rubbing on their big toes

customer_reviews.title: Best Asics for Running So Far
customer_reviews.text: I usually like Asics, but these are by far the best running shoes I have every owned. I was lucky to get them for $70 but I would have paid more if I would have known how well they feel. Really helps with the petella tendinitis in my knee. I can run 5 miles and have no pain the rest of the day. Arch support is solid as well. No pain in my left arch (which I usually get with other shoes).
customer_reviews.author: ranthon007

customer_reviews.title: Seems to run a bit narrow.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits narrower than the last pair I had. They also run smaller than other brands (about 1 full size for me), but I already knew that from previous experience. However, I had to return this pair because It was too narrow in the toe box. I ordered the wider size (first time I have ever ordered a wide shoe) and it fits much better. Good shoe once you find the correct fit.
customer_reviews.author: Rick H.

customer_reviews.title: Run half size small compared to nike or adidas
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the asics because of my plantar faciitis. The podiatrist suggested this and another brand. I ordered these of amazon. I usually wear a size 11 in nike and adidas. But had to return these as my toes were rubbing against the stitch/trim at the front edge. I returned these and have ordered 11.5 for the same shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Multi-purpose shoe
customer_reviews.text: My second pair. I'm a 20-25 mile/week runner and the first pair held up well. One of my original reasons for getting this style (all black) was that we were going on trip to Europe and they were a couple occasions where it was necessary to dress "nicely" (trousers, button-up shirt). I didn't want to pack a pair of dress shoes just to wear a couple of times during a 2 week trip. These all black running shoes served the purpose. Since I've been running in the first pair weekly for the past year, I figured a new pair would serve the same purpose on this trip.
customer_reviews.author: Garage woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support and very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: The GT 1000 has great arch support for my feet! Very comfortable for walks and jogs. The black style is better for wearing at work than the usual pink or orange affair. This is my third or fourth pair and have been happy with every one.
customer_reviews.author: ktubaman

customer_reviews.title: Another good ASICS shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable but maybe a tad small in the toe area. I wear ASICS shoes for work and normally the shoes are about the same size but this pair is narrow in the toe area. Concerned about the seller. As always, Amazon customer service came through but, the shoes had been worn, the bottoms and toe area were scuffed and both shoes had white paint spattered on them. Since I bought them for work and the blemishes were minor I did not return them but it definitely is not normal. When these shoes wear out I would buy them again (from a different Amazon seller).
customer_reviews.author: T Meredith

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I buy Asics for the support of the shoe. The soles of the shoe are already breaking down, and there is no support now. The tips of the soles are coming apart from the shoe. This is a very inferior product from Asics. I have been buying Asics for several years, and never had a problem.......until now. I would not recommend these shoes. Customer service for the company never responded to email. I would not use this company as well.
customer_reviews.author: cw

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE... ASICS
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE... ASICS Was very scared to order shoes from the internet, but to my delight the Asic's fit pretty nicely! I already had a pair of running shoes by them so I stuck with the same size and fits wonderful! I love working out in these shoes, my old running shoes model is no longer being made 1150's I think so I needed something to replace them, I looked at A LOT of Asic's on Amazon and it came down to these, they had the most similar design for dollar in my opinion, that was in my size (Got a smidge bigger foot than most dudes)
customer_reviews.author: Shane G.

customer_reviews.title: Been wearing this line of running shoes for 24 years ...
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing this line of running shoes for 24 years. Considered returning because this one is a tad bit narrower in the toe box than previous versions but not so narrow that I can't wear them. Other than that, I've never had a problem or any pain or discomfort while wearing them. Listen up ASICS - if it ain't broke. don't fix it! Please go back to the original width. You almost lost a long term customer.
customer_reviews.author: OrangeFan

customer_reviews.title: For the price, these are Very Good shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are good shoes! Good lateral firmness, heel-toe balance, and lots of spring-back "bounce" in the gel and EVA rubber. I coached Cross Country for a College/University for 10 years, so I've seen a lot of running shoes! ASICS are usually a good value. These are particularly good. For $44 (what I paid), I don't think you'll find a finer running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Long Distance Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Best long distance walking shoe - your joints, especially knees, feel much better than most other walking shoes. Re: Long Distance - I typically walk on these 4 miles per day (120 miles per month) on my feet 2 hours or more per day with very good results.
customer_reviews.author: Private Investor

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Shoe, Too Wide
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get a wider width, and larger size due to the reviews, now I wish I had gotten a smaller width, the size issue was true because this is .5 bigger than what I normally wear (9), and my toe just barely grazes the top of the shoe. There's no doubt that if I could exchange these for a smaller width, this would easily be a 5 star shoe. It's INCREDIBLE, so light, makes running SO EASY and this is my first step towards getting into running. I enjoy ASICS in general, so this was a great overall experience.
customer_reviews.author: Neitousama

customer_reviews.title: Too small and small toe space.
customer_reviews.text: Asics sizing has changed from past models of their shoes. The newer shoes are much narrower and have less toe space. Buying a larger size doesn't solve the problem, because that makes the shoe too long. I wider size doesn't work either, because the toe space still remains too small. Asics shoes have always been of high quality, but the new sizes don't seem to work for me. I will have to try another brand of shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoe for Mild Overpronation
customer_reviews.text: I got my first run in on these today and they were very comfortable. I am usually on the cusp of needing a 2E shoe, so I got this pair in 2E and they fit perfectly.. maybe even slightly snug. Usually an Asics 2E leaves me with a little play so I'm pretty confident that these are a little narrow relative to Asics I've had in the past. If you're on the edge of needing a wider shoe, go with the wider one on this model.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Quality and materials are weak, but great fit and cushion
customer_reviews.text: Had these for 5 months, put on 180 miles running on sidewalks, and the sole is extremely worn. I'm big (6'4"/240lbs), so not sure if that's to be expected. Toe cap is peeling away. Cushioning is great, as is fit, but quality and materials are lame. That said, these have been great for my running - no shin splints, no ankle pain. Just wish they would have lasted a bit longer. But, given the low price, I'm buying another pair as replacements...
customer_reviews.author: J. Rushin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.. bought these to replace a two year ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good.. bought these to replace a two year old and worn out version no longer available and this model was the closest.. I run only a couple of miles every other day (alternating weight days with running days) and they work for my level of exercise.
customer_reviews.author: SBS

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my third pair. I wear them to work, 9 hours of standing, 5 days a week. I get about 10 months out of a pair, which is far for the low price. I have a wide foot and wear an 8 1/2 in women's shoes, and find it really hard to find comfy work shoes. Men's regular width are a woman's wide, so these fit perfect the first time worn. I wear a men's 8 in Asics, because they run real small. So, order keep that in mind when ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3rd time may be the charm
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to try for work shoe since I am on my feet on concrete floors 10 to 12 hours a day. They were recommended by a few coworkers and orthopedic doctor. Even though I ordered the 4E wide shoe had to return and reorder twice. Ended up one full size larger than normal to eliminate the squeeze. First to pair were very tight across the top and just before the arch. The reason for 3 stars is that I just got the 3rd pair this past Thursday 2/15/18 and only wore for one day at work. So only time will tell but at least now they are not to tight.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Powell

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoe but bare bones cushioning
customer_reviews.text: First, the length is true to size. I ordered a 7 instead of my 6 because people say it runs small. Length-wise, nope. Width, they are narrow. I got the EE width and my feet felt comfortable enough although my right heel felt loose as it was a size up. I don't recommend sizing up. They offer a decent amount of support but there is hardly any cushioning. I'm returning them to try the GT-2000s, which I was debating on getting before settling on these. I understand that product offers more cushioning and may be considered a superior version of this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: very pleased..
customer_reviews.text: Hubby runs & walks 60-70 miles per week. He's not a big guy, but he must be a hard heel-striker because he typically wears out the heel of a shoe in only 3-4 weeks! We have tried every brand, including some very expensive Brooks, with the same result. These are the first shoes that have lasted longer than 3 weeks. We are at 7 weeks and just now beginning to show some wear in the heel. Very, very pleased...thus ends a 5 year search for the perfect running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Many

customer_reviews.title: great for all runners and especially for those with injuries
customer_reviews.text: I was dealing with shin splints and an ankle issue, so I thought it would be a good idea to purchase a new pair of sneakers to get better support. These were the best deal for me. They provided excellent protection for my injuries, yet allowing me to run either pain-free or with much less pain than before. ASICS has a slighly harder bottom than Nike (what I had before), but the wear and tear is improved because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Thumbs down guy

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye, Asics.
customer_reviews.text: Be warned! If you had a previous version of the GT-1000's and expect these to fit the same, don't! They are more narrow than previous models. I wear wide and the wide was a lot more narrow They caused my plantar fascitis to flare up on 2 out of 2 long distance runs. The old version did not. Made the switch to Hoka Ones and am never going back, because Asics can't seem to keep their shoe sizes consistent.
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow Despite 4E Width
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet. Asics, in the past, was the go-to shoe for me, since they made 4E sizes. These were the only type of running shoe that would feel comfortable. With my 4th pair needing replacement, I ordered the GT-1000 in 4E width. My foot could barely fit into the shoe. It certainly didn't feel like a wide shoe. Not sure if there was a mislabeling event or Asics now defines 4E width in this manner. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Aigoo

customer_reviews.title: The other reviews about the big toe rubbing the top are true!
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews about the big toe rubbing the top are true. Also I typically use a size 7.5 or 8 at most depending on brand, yet even at an 8 these are a little tight. Btw I've used the GT-1000 1 & 2 over 4 years and they were great. I've tried-on the GT-1000 3 (I didn't care for the angle of the front sole) and 4 (big toe also rubbed) and passed on them. I was unable to find anything else usable in black-on-black and as I know the 4 is no better I figured I'd take the chance and get these online.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Very Narrow and Pointy
customer_reviews.text: Too Narrow. My older GT1000 3 (navy blue) at size 12 4e is roomier than the 1000 5 (dark gray)at 12.5 4e. The 1000 5 is also pointy. The GT1000 4 12.5 4E (light gray and black in photo. Yes, i have two of the same model) is a tad wide, but i love running in it. Dear Asics, please keep your sizes standardized, its always been an experiment to get your shoes. Amazon recommended me a 12 D for this model and that would have been a disaster if i got D width. The local distributor does not carry 12 or 12.5 4E, and i have to resort to buying overseas.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo R

customer_reviews.title: ASICS...Wide versions need to be more than a few mm wider than your regular model
customer_reviews.text: Tried several different widths & sizes of this model, but I guess ASICS designers just don't understand the idea that some people have wide feet. Even the 4E version of these shoes were just WAY too narrow to fit my feet. I never had this problem with other brands like New Balance or Nike. I really wanted to try these out too.
customer_reviews.author: Jotaku

customer_reviews.title: the fit is about fine my normal size is 12 1/2 2 e this ...
customer_reviews.text: the fit is about fine my normal size is 12 1/2 2 e this shoe is 12 1/2 4e and they fit the same as a 2e but they are a good shoe i been buying new balance for years and now they been running to small so two years ago I started buying acics which are not as bad as the new balance size wise .the shoes does hold up well I am 6'2 and 240 and they last about a year but I don't wear them all the time i do wear boots to work and boots when in winter.
customer_reviews.author: jr29657

customer_reviews.title: A little snug
customer_reviews.text: Normally wear an 8.5 but ordered a 9M. Length is ok but the front of the shoe seems snug. I'm keeping them hoping they will loosen a bit after they are broken in. Not as comfy as my last pair of ASICS. Update 12/2017: Been wearing them since September and for me, they are not comfortable. Still a little snug. Not sure why different versions of the same model shoe fit differently. I don't care for these.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Grandma Approved
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a runner but usually buy running shoes due to having to walk a few miles every day. These shoes are perfect for that and are even somewhat waterproof. My grandma always thinks they are brand new when she sees me wearing them, so they are definitely grandma approved.
customer_reviews.author: Pattycakes

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable and durable to boot!
customer_reviews.text: I buy these for my friend who is a letter carrier every year for Christmas. He LOVES these so much, I bought a pair for myself where I actually wear these instead of dress shoes at work. I ended up buying another pair (white) for when I am not working and have not worn anything other than Asics for about 5 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, but not for long distance running.
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality shoe, but not a great long distance running. I only have abput 40 miles on these shoes and I can already feel that the cushioning and support is not going to last much beyond 100 miles; if even that far. I was hoping for a usable range of 250 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: They were a bit smaller in size but they were still comfortable. A half size larger than normal might be ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not worn them extensively, but they seem to have a more cushiony feel to them. It could be that the sole is slightly thicker. They were a bit smaller in size but they were still comfortable. A half size larger than normal might be a good choice for most people.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Kinne

customer_reviews.title: gret running shoes,  don't hesitate, are gret.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a long time user of the Mizuno brand, and didn't expect much of such a hype brand, however I found great quality, comfort and lightweight shoes. going to buy again and again and again .... because a runner should replenish running shoes at least three times per year.
customer_reviews.author: datelligence

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to size width
customer_reviews.text: I can't really comment on the product because it didn't fit. All I can say is that a "2E" is definitely not the same as a "wide." It looked like a normal, narrow pair of shoes. I confirmed that both the box and the tags on the shoes said "2E" I wear a 13 wide normally, but based on the E system, I might need a 13 4E. Good luck fellow bigfoots.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Lerma

customer_reviews.title: Asics as is
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes! Great for my flat feet. I found these cheaper on Amazon then the local sport stores. When I tried them on in the store, I had to go a 1/2 size up from my usual shoe size. No problem tho. The store didn't have the size except what was on display. Luckily Amazon had the shoes. Asics are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Ron M

customer_reviews.title: Good everyday shoe.  ASICS is a great brand
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent shoe at a good price. I really like the ASICS brand and buy them for their quality and comfort. I bought this to replace my old GT-2140 shoes which lasted forever and were very comfortable. I don't think the new shoes are as good in quality or comfort, but I still like them. I use the shoe as an everyday shoe and it is good for just about everything I do.
customer_reviews.author: All American Kid

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes-happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: About what I expected. Only used them for 4 short (1mile) walks so far. Good cushioning and stability. Like the all black color as I'm just not into all the neon color billboards shoes have become.
customer_reviews.author: T. R. Turton

customer_reviews.title: Best walk/run shoe ever had!
customer_reviews.text: No other shoe of this type is as comfy as Asics! And I hate all the stripes and swirls on most shoes. Prefer plain, featureless black. I bought 6 pairs of these.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Ridlen

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, lots of cushion and support
customer_reviews.text: great shoes, very comfortable, great fit, lots of arch support, and the best part NOT made in china. i am a runner since jr high and used to wear Nike but somewhere down the road they went south, switched to Asics; i've been using this brand since my college days in late 90"s early 00"s.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fix it !!

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are probably the most comfortable shoes I've worn in a long time
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are probably the most comfortable shoes I've worn in a long time. The only problem is they creek and squeak with every step I take. I sound like Squidward walking around. If you're a ninja or need quiet shoes, don't get these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Asics brand sizing runs small
customer_reviews.text: Good looking, well made shoe but I had to return them. They were at least a 1/2 size if not a full size too small. I have spoken with several people since receiving these shoes and a consistent response is that Asics brand definitely runs small.
customer_reviews.author: bkworm

customer_reviews.title: A good shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I did not need arch support pads. It's a good quality running shoe that is well ventilated and maintains its form while reducing shock impact on my knees.
customer_reviews.author: Danimal

customer_reviews.title: the other had a great width, this one has a 4e width all ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pair in a 9 4e and another asics from amazon in a 9 4e. the other had a great width, this one has a 4e width all the way until the top and then sharply goes narrow in the toes where you actually need width. What is going on with asics?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes if you like bleeding.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes just wore out so ridiculously quickly. I used them for walking. The back of my shoes where it fit up against my Achilles wore out within 2 months and began cutting into the back of my Achilles area. I wouldn't recommend these. I am definitely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow for 4E Width
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several pair of ASICS GT's over the years and they have all fit nicely. I have a wider foot and was surprised these there somewhat narrower than other ASICS 4E width I have ordered previously. I am hoping they stretch out a bit and get more comfortable but may have to live with them being tight. I do like the color and the soles offer good cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Fishin' Fool

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfull shoes, very good support and comfortability! Definitely recommend. Sizing is just like any other Asics shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jurga

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe and very pleased with it. However, I most likely will get the Gt-2000 Running shoe for other activities. These most likely will be general walking around and other activities beside fitness. They are good for fitness but I am going to be trying the Gt-2000 in size 4E. I finding that the 4E is a much better fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: mlp

customer_reviews.title: Order a half size larger.
customer_reviews.text: If you have never ordered these shoes before, they run a bit small. I wear a 9 and order a 9.5. They fit perfect just a half size larger. The quality is very good. When you work 14 hour shifts, you need good shoes and these work beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Summersvet

customer_reviews.title: I've run in ASICS for years and now that I've ...
customer_reviews.text: I've run in ASICS for years and now that I've injured my back, I use them as daily shoes. The GT 1000 5's don't seem to have the quality that I'm used to. The stitching is sub-par and the toe rubber is already coming away on one shoe. Not what I've come to expect from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R.

customer_reviews.title: These shoes offer good support for pronation without the PowerStep (or other) shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: I have posterior tibial tendonitis. These shoes offer good support for pronation without the PowerStep (or other) shoe inserts. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top-quality, durable, and useable for all activities.
customer_reviews.text: I use these shoes when I: run, workout, travel with a lot of walking. The sole is long-term durable, the shoe itself is made well, and it breathes as much as a regular running shoe would (just remember to breathe while running too).
customer_reviews.author: czerwonymaciek

customer_reviews.title: I do have narrow feet so these fit fine but are a little more snug than what I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the GT-1000 3. As some reviews said these run a bit narrow. I do have narrow feet so these fit fine but are a little more snug than what I'm used to. I rated the GT-1000 3 with 5 stars, but the 5's are not quite as comfy. I use these for walking only so can't rate them for running. I do like the color and style of the 5's.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: 2 years of extreme use. Love them
customer_reviews.text: 2 years wearing these shoes doing cardio TWICE. Day and lifting once. They are starting to get holes in them now and tear but that's longer then any workout shoe has ever lasted me. Sad to see them go. Need a new pair
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Madia

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes; but required 1/2 size larger than usual
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes; but required 1/2 size larger than my last pair of ASICS and previously purchased size 11 shoes, which I typically wear. Wide 4E barely wide enough for my wide feet. Having read the reviews suggesting these run small, I ordered 1/2 size larger, so did not have to return
customer_reviews.author: r.a.b

customer_reviews.title: Great for Stability!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after doing research on which brands and models would help with pronation for my son, and they do a great job of supporting his arch. So much so that he appears to walk normally and one would not know that his foot/ankle would pronate otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra W

customer_reviews.title: Good construction
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this style. It has plenty of sole that should make this shoe last for a good while. It is comfortable to wear and price was reasonable. I don't use them for running only for walking. Use for 5 to 7 miles daily and don't cause fatigue. I always choose this brand as the fit is consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in how they decided to make there widths 1 size smaller
customer_reviews.text: Asics somehow decided to make there widths one size smaller to a 3 E . Without any notice so I guess I have to go back to New Balance . There quality has gone down especially in the area of the upper mesh where it can rip very easily . They are comfortable so that is why the got 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: drew

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy shoe
customer_reviews.text: My son rips through shoes. However, this one held up, which is very typical of Asics. Every shoe I have ever bought has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and fitting shoe.  Great for people with larger frames.  Supports and cushions better than other shoes I've used.
customer_reviews.text: Great looking and fitting shoe. Very comfortable....I've purchased about 10 pairs of ASICS over the past 10 years and have never been disappointed. I'm 350lbs and ASICS shoes support and cushion great. I would recommend these shoes to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were recommended by my podiatrist as having the right stiffness in the sole for someone with "flat feet" like me. I still need orthotics, but it remains that these are the most comfortable shoes I've had in ages.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett Barouch

customer_reviews.title: not for running - or walking
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made - bottom is soft and not for people that need arch support. Toe area really is tight from the top down - width is fine. Worst - shoe for running ever
customer_reviews.author: Richard in OC

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat smaller than the same model of earlier shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pair to replace a similar pair of ASICS that had worn out. Even though it is the same model in the same size, the toe area seems to be smaller with less room than the shoes it replaces. And, it is not because the other shoes have stretched. They always had more room in the toe area than this pair. I wore them in the house for several days before deciding to keep them, but it was a close call.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Overpronators rejoice!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Asics. I'm a super overpronator. Asics makes a higher-end running shoe that is even better for us overpronators, but these are good and they hit the right price point for someone like me who isn't running.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Bridges

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoe at a great price
customer_reviews.text: We had the benefit of having an earlier purchase of similar brand. Since the kid grew out of that pair, we selected this as a full size larger so he can grow into it. Fit as expected. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Serrao

customer_reviews.title: Decent staying power
customer_reviews.text: We've had these for 4 or so months. My son wears them every day and these have held up pretty well. I wish we had more options in a stability shoe, but he likes these. We may have to replace them before the end of the school year, but so far they are doing ok.
customer_reviews.author: Chouser

customer_reviews.title: # 5 - THE GT-1000 5 series is even better. The sizing of the shoe was consistent from ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased the last 2 versions of this shoe. 3 and 4. # 5 - THE GT-1000 5 series is even better. The sizing of the shoe was consistent from the previous, in my case, size 10. The quality is also consistent, if not better. But, lets see if they can take 2 years of running like the last ones :).
customer_reviews.author: sn8keyz

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful shoes made from poor quality material
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are undoubtedly very beautiful, price is good too. Very light weight, fits great and provides great comfort. The quality of material used is very bad, started to wear out from multiple places very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Sumit Mehta

customer_reviews.title: needed wider shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with my purchase. I needed a wider shoe and this running shoe is perfect. I'm a female that needs a good running shoe. A friend told me to look onto a man's running shoe. And there it is..
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Fast as Lightening
customer_reviews.text: I love ASICS shoes. I have worn them for the past 10 years. However, do not purchase the low end ASICS for sports activities. Purchase the higher end models for the needed support, stability, and cushion. Make sure there is gel in the front and back.
customer_reviews.author: MattMan

customer_reviews.title: After buying older generations of this shoe, this 5th ...
customer_reviews.text: After buying older generations of this shoe, this 5th gen runs a little tight. Hopefully it'll stretch out a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Al C

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM
customer_reviews.text: Love ASICS and love these shoes. Undying cushioning good enough for a big man and sharp looking as well. Bought these as a workout shoe but liked the way they look so use them for everyday shoe
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeyefanjustin

customer_reviews.title: Came without inside soles!
customer_reviews.text: This one is a bit cheaper made than the normal Asics running shoes - but decent - but this one came without any inside soles! someone took the soles out, yet this was still shipped to me. I pulled the soles out of my old shoes and just put them in these "new" ones. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LIKE PILLOWS FOR YOUR FEET!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best running shoe made. I've worn them for a previous marathon, and I wore these during a two-week trip to the east coast, in which I walked SEVERAL miles, and my feet felt great. They're extremely light and comfortable. Great value!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't worn them a lot, but do far they are pretty comfortable and fit as expected. Bought some GT-1000 6 and the wear snd tear on the inside was quick. Not as durable as most Asics I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Asics Men's GT-1000 Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: This pair of shoes are lighter than the previous model I have. Not as plush inner lining but still comfortable with good support. Ordered the same size as the ones I already had and they fit nearly perfectly. Label indicates that they were made In Vietnam, same as the older ones I have. Quite pleased with the older ones I have so expect much the same with these.
customer_reviews.author: Hal O

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, happy feet!
customer_reviews.text: My dodgy feet love these shoes. No problems with my feet now
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to the Model#
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to shoes. I've tried every brand and keep coming back to this one. Make sure your pay attention to the model number and find the right shoe for your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. O.

customer_reviews.title: Not the  usual fit
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these pair of shoes after waiting for ASICS Corp to have them in stock. The shoes are just slightly too small, not enough to return them, they will stretch with wear. They did appear to look old or compress, just something I noticed upon opening the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the shoe and they are ok now once they ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair at the store, and bought the same size again online, and they seem to fit little differently(a little snug in the toe area). Love the shoe and they are ok now once they stretched out a little. Must just be a slight inconsistency in the manufacturing process.
customer_reviews.author: ToddOH

customer_reviews.title: Third pair of identical shoe.
customer_reviews.text: One thing about Asics-they are consistent with size and fit. Only sneaker I will wear.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Boy

customer_reviews.title: Great asic shoe as always I have been wearing asic ...
customer_reviews.text: Great asic shoe as always I have been wearing asic for the last 10 years highly recommended to anyone looking for a great running shoe or just a shoe to walk around with
customer_reviews.author: David Coppola

customer_reviews.title: The 1000s are much better choice for concrete
customer_reviews.text: I've bought the gel venture after my last pair of 1000s wore out. I run/walk on concrete all day and my feet would hurt after one day with the ventures. The 1000s are much better choice for concrete!
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes. I'm 41 and have always worked on my feet. I have a bad ankle to top it off. These are the only shoes that don't have me screaming at the end of my shift. I'm also required to wear all black. That's not easy to find with the support I need. I am a woman who wears a 9, I just bought a 7.5. fits fine. Thank you Asics
customer_reviews.author: charity rogers

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I can trust Asics anymore. Version 4 of these in 9.5 were huge, fit almost like a size 10. Decided to go with size 9 and they fit like an 8.5. Really disappointing cause I really like Asics. Bought a different brand pair and they fit just perfect. I might have to give up on them all together.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Shoes are great. I am a 11
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are great. I am a 11.5 2e and I went with the D width. I should’ve got my regular size the 2e so the shoes fit perfect when ordering the size you normally wear
customer_reviews.author: Trucker

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoe I have ever worn
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoe I have ever worn. This is my second pair after first was recommended to me by my granddaughter who, at the time worked for Academy Sports. She told me to get a half size larger and being an obedient "Pop" I did as she suggested and bingo perfect!
customer_reviews.author: pop43

customer_reviews.title: I think it’s way too wide.. I returned ...
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s way too wide.. I returned the item but it’s been a while and I haven’t gotten my refund yet..
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Shoe was everything i expected. I've used Asics for many years and they've never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: rkkiii

customer_reviews.title: GT-1000 is a great budget shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. I have owned several part of the 1000 series. They are always a good but if you need a bit of support when running, walking etc....
customer_reviews.author: kfuller

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Size is not right.. Usually I use size 10 but this one is too small
customer_reviews.author: kilani

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Asics makes the best running shoes for my wide-@ss Fred Flintstone feet. Very comfortable in a true 4E. Great cushions in this pair. The reflectors on the backs are great for early morning walks and runs.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Good, but they shrunk them down by 1/2 size
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, but they lowered the sizes by 1/2. I ordered US 9 last year and they fit. Now they are 1/2 size smaller...Either my feet are growing or there mold is shrinking...
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good all around shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to travel in Europe. Dark shoes work best there and I wanted to blend in (a little). Very comfortable and did some light hiking in the Alps with them. Kept all my toenails, so must be decent.
customer_reviews.author: JasJ

customer_reviews.title: Teachers Best Friend
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing the GT-1000 series since v3 and I can say I love this shoe. I am a teacher and stand for ~10 hours a day and these shoes save my life. Buy the black pair and they will go with any outfit. They do run narrow in the toe box so you may want to go to a box store and try one on to see if you need the wide (4e). Only reason I gave this a 4 star is because for some crazy reason the shoe perpetually squeaked when I walked. Both sneakers, every footfall, squeeeeeek. Too comfortable to send back. Just bought the GT-1000 v6
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Still great product
customer_reviews.text: Nice and comfortable. Great support and looks great. I work on cement floors all day and these keep the punishment down.
customer_reviews.author: Epp35

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It fit perfect on the sides but length was a little big. But extremely comfortable. Makes my job much better being on my feet all day.
customer_reviews.author: a.m.

customer_reviews.title: Have been buying the GT1000 since it was the 1000 ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been buying the GT1000 since it was the 1000 2. I currently have 7 pairs of these in various colors. I have flat feet. These are the first athletic shoes I can wear for 10 hours a day and not have aching feet. Also, regardless what the tags say, you can machine wash these. Take the insoles out, wash on gentle and let them air dry.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Supports your movement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased them for intent with work. I am on my feet 99.9 of my work day and always in motion. This shoe immediately it feels like it propels me forward when I walk supporting my motion. Can’t say I” run” in them but I sure walk and move at a higher pace then most jog! Awesome shoe and neon green goes well with any fashion !
customer_reviews.author: Atrocity

customer_reviews.title: Great for walking
customer_reviews.text: Use them for walking. I am 72 and retired from running but I ran in Asics shoes for years with good results so I continue to use them now that I just walk. These shoes are comfortable and feel stable. I am very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe for running
customer_reviews.text: My husband's old pair had worn out, and he loved these shoes for running. So, we just went on and ordered the exact same shoe. It was a great fit, it was a great deal, and we got it very quickly. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: JMill

product_meta.title: Asics Gt-1000 5 Running Shoe
product_meta.description: Set the pace at your next half-marathon in the new, lighter GT-1000 running shoe. Support, comfort and cushioning – this one has it all, so you're prepared to make it to the finish line at your first race and ready to go again when you finish your second. The GT-1000 is a perfect complement to your body's movement. By using fewer layers, the lightweight upper effectively hugs your foot and feels like a second skin. The stabilising technology stops your foot rolling inwards right from the very start of your race, improving your endurance and pace. Make a landing softer every time thanks to the rear and forefoot GEL cushioning Let your foot guide from the moment it touches the ground to the moment you push off Get the support you need to take on long distances
feature_bullets: Impact Guidance System (I.G.S.) (running): The Asics design philosophy that uses linked components to improve the natural gaiter from heel to toe.
Gel Padding System for the Forefoot and Back of the Foot - Reduces shock during the impact and toe phases and allows you to move on multiple planes as the foot passes through the wasp cycle.
SpEVA midsole: The material improves bounce characteristics and decreases breakdown of the midsole
Guidance Line: Vertical bending groove decouples the tool along the progress line for greater efficiency.
